div1.head: Press release by Frank Carey, Associated Press Science Reporter, June 24, 1950
div1.p: (ADVANCE FOR AMS OF SUNDAY, JUNE 25
BY FRANK CAREY
ASSOCIATED PRESS SCIENCE REPORTER

(ADVANCE) WASHINGTON, JUNE 24--(AP)--TOMORROW IS THE
50TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE START OF HISTORIC EXPERIMENTS LEADING TO
THE CONQUERING OF YELLOW FEVER.

IT WAS ON JUNE 25, 1900 THAT MAJOR WALTER REED
OF THE ARMY MEDICAL CORPS ARRIVED IN HAVANA AT THE HEAD OF AN
ARMY BOARD APPOINTED TO INVESTIGATE THE CAUSE OF THE MYSTERIOUS "SAFFRON HORRO

YELLOW FEVER, Chief among the diseases WHICH HAD KILLED MORE AMERICANS IN
THE RECENT SPANISH WAR THAN WERE SLAIN BY SPANISH BULLETS, WAS EPIDEMIC
ONCE MORE IN HAVANA. ALREADY IT HAD CLAIMED MANY LIVES AMONG THE ARMY
OF OCCUPATION.

p.del:
REED WAS KNOWN AS A “TROUBLE SHOOTER” OF THE
ARMY SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE. HE HAD MADE MAJOR CONTRIBUTIONS TO T
UNDERSTANDING OF TYPHOID FEVER AND CERTAIN OTHER ILLS HAD PLAG
THE TROOPS IN VARIOUS PARTS OF THE WORLD.

div1.p:
BUT HE HAD NEVER SEEN AN ACTUAL CASE OF
YELLOW FEVER.

REED AND THREE COLLEAGUES HAD BEEN COMMISSIONED TO TACKLE
SOMETHING WHICH HAD ELUDED MEDICAL UNDERSTANDING FOR CENTURIES--A DISEASE
WHICH HAD TAKEN A TERRIFIC TOLL IN MANY PARTS OF THE WORLD, ESPECIALLY THE
TROPICS.

IN THE UNITED STATES, IT HAD STRUCK WITH EPIDEMIC FRIGHTFULNESS
OVER THE YEARS IN SUCH CITIES AS PHILADELPHIA, BOSTON, NEW ORLEANS,
CHARLESTON, NORFOLK, NEW YORK AND MEMPHIS--KILLING THOUSANDS.

IT WAS A DISEASE WHICH, IN PAST EPIDEMICS, HAD SOMETIMES CAUSED
PEOPLE TO FALL SUDDENLY IN THE STREETS, THEIR BODIES WRACKED WITH PAIN,
Later THEIR EYES AND FACES could YELLOWED WITH JAUNDICE, THEIR STOMACHS RETCHING
FORTH THE DREAD “BLACK VOMIT.” OTHERS DIED IN SOLITUDE, ABANDONED BY
THEIR LOVED ONES WHO HAD FLED TO THE HILLS FROM THE STRICKEN CITIES.

SOMETIMES DEATHS WERE SO NUMEROUS THAT CORPSES LAY UNBURIED
FOR DAYS, AND DRIVERS OF DEATH CARTS PATROLLED THE SILENT STREETS, UTTERIng
A TERRIBLE CRY: “BRING OUT YOUR DEAD, BRING OUT YOUR DEAD.”

NO ONE KNEW THE CAUSE OF THE SICKNESS. BUT, IN THE FALSE
BELIEF THAT IT WAS DUE TO SOME MYSTERIOUS “POISON” IN THE AIR, MEN
FIRED CANNON BALLS INTO THE AIR ATMOSPHERE, OR BURNED TAR POTS--TO TRY TO
DISPELL THE MENACE.

IT REMAINED FOR REED AND HIS ASSOCIATES TO DEMONSTRATE THAT
THE DISEASE, WHATEVER ITS ACTUAL CAUSE MIGHT BE, WAS TRANSMITTED
BY SOMETHING IN THE AIR--A MOSQUITO.

YEARS AFTER REED'S DEATH IN 1902, SCIENTISTS DISCOVERED
THE ACTUAL CAUSE OF YELLOW FEVER--A VIRUS--AND THIS AND OTHER FINDINGS
HAVE RESULTED IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A PROTECTIVE VACCINE.

BUT THE WORK OF REED AND HIS ASSOCIATES MADE IT POSSIBLE
TO CONTROL YELLOW FEVER WHEREVER IT DEVELOPED BY RIDDING THE
AREA OF THE PARTICULAR MOSQUITO INVOLVED.

THEIR RESEARCH--RATED BY SOME AUTHORITIES AS RANKING close IN
IMPORTANCE WITH THE DISCOVERY OF ANESTHESIA--MADE POSSIBLE
THE COMPLETION OF THE PANAMA CANAL, ONCE KNOWN AS THE “WHITE MAN'S
GRAVEYARD” BECAUSE OF DEATHS FROM YELLOW FEVER.

THEIR PROOF THAT THE DISEASE WAS MOSQUITO-BORNE AND
NOT CONTAGIOUS MADE IT POSSIBLE TO MODIFY GREATLY THE COSTLY QUARANTINE
MEASURES WHICH HAD PREVIOUSLY CLOSED GREAT SEAPORTS, SLOWING THE
COMMERCE OF THE WORLD.

ALSO, THEIR PROOF THAT THE DISEASE WAS NOT PASSED FROM
MAN TO MAN BY CONTACT MADE IT POSSIBLE TO ELIMINATE ANOTHER COSTLY
PRACTICE--THAT OF BURNING FURNITURE, BEDDING AND CLOTHING USED BY
VICTIMS OF THE PLAGUE.

BUT ALL THESE FEATS WERE THINGS OF THE FUTURE WHEN
REED ARRIVED IN HAVANA.

IN FACT, HE HIMSELF HAD NEVER SEEN AN ACTUAL CASE OF
YELLOW FEVER UP TO THAT TIME. although he had an established
reputation as a medical “Trouble shooter.”

p.del: WHY THEN HAD HE BEEN PICKED FOR THIS TOUGH ASSIGNMENT?

RETIRED BRIGADIER GENERAL JEFFERSON RANDOLPH KEAN--89
NOW LIVING IN WASHINGTON HAS THIS THEORY:

"REED WAS A KIND OF TROUBLE SHOOTER FOR THE ARMY
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE

div1.p:
HE SAW HIS FIRST CASE THAT DAY HE ARRIVED. HE HURRIED TO
THE BEDSIDE OF HIS OLD FRIEND, MAJOR JEFFERSON RANDOLPH KEAN, CHIEF
SURGEON OF THE ARMY'S DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA, WHO HAD BEEN STRICKEN WITH
YELLOW FEVER.

“MY RECOLLECTION OF HIS VISIT IS VERY DIM--I WAS PRETTY
SICK,” KEAN TOLD A REPORTER TODAY.

BUT KEAN, NOW 89, AND A RETIRED BRIGADIER GENERAL, GAVE a
VIVID PICTURE OF THE SITUATION THAT PREVAILED AT THE TIME OF REED'S ARRIVAL IN THE TOWN OF QUEMADOS
NEAR HAVANA WHERE THE ARMY'S COLUMBIA BARRACKS WAS LOCATED.

“WE HAD A VERY WHOLESOME TERROR OF YELLOW FEVER,” HE
SAID, SIPPING A SOCIABLE COCKTAIL, AS HIS THOUGHTS RACED BACK 50 YEARS.
“WE DIDN'T KNOW WHAT TO DO ABOUT IT.”

SOLDIERS AND HIGH-PLACED OFFICERS INCLUDING DOCTORS WERE COMING DOWN
RIGHT AND LEFT WITH THE FEVER, AND SO WERE THEIR WIVES. PEOPLE BURNED
SULFUR CANDLES TO “PURGE THE AIR.” ELEGANTLY DRESSED ARMY WIVES WORE
SMELLY BAGS OF ASAFETIDA AND SPIT CONSTANTLY OUT THEIR CARRIAGE WINDOWS
in THE BELIEF THEY WERE OFFSETTING INFECTION. THE ARMY BURNED TENTS AND BEDDING USED BY FEVER VICTIMS. AND AT SUNDOWN IN THE
OFFICERS' MESS, RECALLED THE OLD GENERAL, VETERANS OF THE INDIAN AND
SPANISH WARS DRANK “TO THOSE WHO HAVE ALREADY GONE-AND HERE'S TO THE
NEXT TO GO!”

KEAN SAID THERE WAS NO SPECIFIC TREATMENT. PATIENTS WERE
DENIED FOOD WHILE THEIR FEVER WAS HIGH--“THE FIRST THING WE GAVE THEM WAS
CHAMPAGNE BECAUSE IT WAS NOURISHING WITHOUT REQUIRING DIGESTION.”
MOSQUITOES?

“THEY WERE CONSIDERED JUST A NUISANCE AT THAT TIME,” SAId
KEAN WITH AN IRONIC SMILE. “DR. CARLOS FINLAY, A HAVANA PHYSICIAN, HAD
5---
BEEN CLAIMING FOR 19 YEARS THAT MOSQUITOES WERE INVOLVED, BUT IN ALL
THAT TIME HE HAD CONVINCED ONLY ONE OTHER HAVANA DOCTOR. UNFORTUNATELY
DR. FINLAY HAD NOT BEEN ABLE TO PROVE HIS THEORY. IT REMAINED FOR
REED AND HIS ASSOCIATES TO DEMONSTRATE--EMPHASIZE THAT WORD 'DEMONSTRATO'
--THAT OLD DOCTOR FINLAY HAD BEEN RIGHT.”

HOW THEY DEMONSTRATED IT IS RECORDED IN OFFICIAL MEDICAL
REPORTS AND OTHER RECORDS WHICH CONSTITUTE A THRILLING CHAPTER IN THE
HISTORY OF MEDICINE.

REED HAD THREE ASSOCIATES ON THE “YELLOW FEVER BOARD”--
DOCTORS JESSE LAZEAR, JAMES CARROLL AND ARISTIDES AGRAMONTE, THE LATTEr
A CUBAN BY BIRTH.

AFTER SOME PRELIMINARY TESTS ON ANOTHER SLANT, THE BOARD
DECIDED TO TEST THE THEORY OF DR. FINLAY. THAT WAS IN AUGUST.

DOCTOR CARROLL WAS THE FIRST HERO OF THE RESEARCH. HE CONTRACTed
AN ALMOST-FATAL CASE OF FEVER AFTER TWICE ALLOWING HIMSELF TO BE BITTEn
BY MOSQUITOES WHICH HAD FED ON YELLOW FEVER VICTIMS. DR. LAZEAR
ALSO GOT SICK--AND DIED. (WHILE THE OFFICIAL RECORDS SAY THAT
LAZEAR WAS ACCIDENTALLY BITTEN BY AN INFECTED MOSQUITO, GENERAL KEAN
SAYS REED AND THE OTHERS ALWAYS BELIEVED LAZEAR PURPOSELY EXPOSED
HIMSELF TO REPEATED BITES--AND WAS THUS A TRUE MARTYR TO THE RESEARCH.)

AN AMERICAN SOLDIER--WHO VOLUNTEERED TO BE BITTEN IN A SPIRIT
OF BRAVADO AND SCOFFING--ALSO WAS LISTED AS AN EXPERIMENTALLY-INDUCE
CASE OF FEVER.

REED HAD BEEN RECALLED TO WASHINGTON ON OTHER WORK, MEANWHILE,
AND MISSED THESE FIRST TESTS.

BUT ON HIS RETURN IN THE EARLY FALL, HE MADE A BRILLIANT
DEDUCTION BASED ON CERTAIN OBSERVATIONS RECORDED IN DR. LAZEAR'S
LABORATORY RECORDS AND IN A PERSONAL NOTEBOOK FOUND IN LAZEAR'S
6---
BLOUSE AT THE TIME OF HIS DEATH.

THE DEDUCTION WAS THAT A MOSQUITO CAN BECOME INFECTED
ONLY WHEN IT BITES A YELLOW FEVER VICTIM DURING THE FIRST THREE DAYS
OF HIS ILLNESS. MOREOVER, EVEN AFTER THE INFECTION IS PASSED ONTO
THE MOSQUITO, IT REQUIRES AT LEAST 12 DAYS FOR THE DISEASE AGENT TO
DEVELOP IN THE INSECT'S BODY.

FOR THE FIRST TIME IT BECAME CLEAR WHY CERTAIN PREVIOUS
EXPERIMENTS OF OLD DR. FINLAY AND OF THE ARMY BOARD HAD FAILED:--THE
TIME ELEMENT WAS EXTREMELY IMPORTANT.

REED AND HIS COLLEAGUES RUSHED TOGETHER A REPORT OF
THEIR RESEARCH TO DATE, AND IT WAS PRESENTED TO A MEDICAL MEETING
BACK IN THE STATES. BUT THEY WERE PREPARED FOR THE SKEPTICISM THAT
GREETED THE REPORT; THEY REALIZED THAT THE CASES OF EXPERIMENTAL
YELLOW FEVER WERE NOT WHOLLY “CONTROLLED” CASES IN THE SCIENTIFIC
SENSE.

AND SO, IN THE LATE FALL OF 1900, THEY SET UP AN
EXPERIMENT DESIGNED TO SHOW THAT THE MOSQUITO--AND THE MOSQUITO ALONE--
WAS THE VILLAIN IN THE PIECE. THEY ESTABLISHED AN ISOLATED CAMP WHERE
THERE WAS NO CHANCE OF INFECTION FROM PATIENTS ALREADY SICK WITH FEVER.

VOLUNTEERS WERE CALLED FOR. (“THEY WERE TO GET $200
IF THEY CONTRACTED FEVER, $100 IF THEY DIDN'T,” RECALLS GENERAL KEAN
WHO WAS IN CHARGE OF HANDLING THE $10,000 ALLOCATED BY THE ARMY FOR
THE EXPERIMENTS.)

p.del:
AMERICANS, FOUR SPANIARDS, THREE CUBANS,ONE
ENGLISHMAN AND ONE IRISHMAN VOLUNTEERED. THE LATTER--JOHN J.
MORAN--NEVER ACCEPTED A PENNY FOR HIS PART IN THE RESEARCH BECAUSE,
HE TOLD THE ASSOCIATED PRESS RECENTLY.

div1.p:
“I FELT IT WAS A CHANCE TO DO SOME GOOD IN THIS LIFE; ALSO
I DIDN'T WANT THEM WRITING ON MY TOMBSTONE: 'HERE LIES JOHN MORAN, WHO
6A

ALMOST A SCORE OF AMERICAN VOLUNTEERS CAME FORWARD, AND
SOME SPANIARDS. THE AMERICANS INCLUDED SOLDIERS, AND OTHER ARMY-RELATED PERSONNEL, A CIVILIAN LIVING
IN CUBA AND A CIVILIAN ARMY CLERK.

THE LATTER, JOHN J. MORAN, AN IRISHMAN WITH A RICH
BROGUE, HAS NEVER ACCEPTED A PENNY FOR HIS PART IN THE RESEARCH
BECAUSE, HE TOLD THE ASSOCIATED PRESS RECENTLY:

“I FELT IT WAS A CHANCE TO DO SOME GOOD IN THIS
LIFE; ALSO I DIDN'T WANT THEM WRITING ON MY TOMBSTONE: 'HERE
LIES JOHN MORAN, WHO
7----
DIED FOR ($200.)”

MORAN, THEN A CIVILIAN CLERK IN THE ARMY, AND HIS
ROOM-MATE, JOHN J. KISSINGER, A MEDICAL CORPS MAN, WERE THE FIRST
TO VOLUNTEER.

KISSINGER WAS THE FIRST TO FACE THE POSSIBILITY OF DEATH, THE FIRST TO BECOME ILL. HE LET INFECTED
MOSQUITOES BITE HIM ON THE ARM IN A TENT. REED SAID LATER OF
KISSINGER “IN MY OPINION THIS EXHIBITION OF MORAL COURAGE HAS
NEVER BEEN SURPASSED IN THE ANNALS OF THE ARMY OF THE UNITED STATES.”
SOME OTHER VOLUNTEERS WERE ALSO INFECTED THUS.

BUT THE DOCTORS WANTED TO TRY TWO OTHER
THINGS.
THEY BUILT TWO SPECIAL BUILDINGS.

ONE WAS DESIGNED TO PROVE OR DISPROVE THE COMMON THEORY
THAT YELLOW FEVER COULD BE CONTRACTED FROM “FOMITES”--THE SOILED AND
FILTHY BEDDING AND CLOTHING OF YELLOW FEVER VICTIMS.

THE SMALL, ONE-ROOM, POORLY VENTILATED BUILDING WAS
HEATED WITH A COAL STOVE TO TEMPERATURES UP TO 100 DEGREES--“LIKE THE
HOLD OF A SHIP IN THE TROPICS” ONE OF THE DOCTORS LATER RELATED. BUT
IT WAS COMPLETELY SCREENED AGAINST MOSQUITOES.

INTO THAT CHAMBER WENT A NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS. THEY HANDLED
FOUL-SMELLING BEDDING AND CLOTHING, AND FOR 21 NIGHTS SLEPT ON FILTHY
AND BLOOD-STAINED SHEETS. AT TIMES THEY COVERED THEIR PILLOWS WITH
TOWELS SOILED WITH THE BLOOD AND VOMIT OF FEVER VICTIMS. THEY WORE
NIGHTSHIRTS USED BY FEVER VICTIMS. AT TIMES, THE STENCH
WAS ENOUGH TO DRIVE THEM OUT, BUT ALWAYS THEY RETURNED.
NOT ONE OF THEM CONTRACTED YELLOW FEVER.

THE SECOND BUILDING WAS AS IMMACULATE AS THE OTHER ONE WAS
8---
FILTHY, AND IT WAS WELL VENTILATED.

THE ONE-ROOM STRUCTURE WAS DIVIDED INTO TWO PARTS BY WIRE
SCREEN AND MUSLIN. THE IDEA WAS TO EXPOSE A MAN ON ONE SIDE OF THE
ROOM TO THE BITES OF INFECTED MOSQUITOES, WHILE VOLUNTEERS ON THE
OTHER SIDE WERE NOT SO EXPOSED.

FIRST TO BE EXPOSED IN THE “MOSQUITO” SIDE OF THE ROOM WAS
JOHN J. MORAN.

FRESH FROM A BATH, AND CLAD ONLY IN A NIGHT SHIRT, HE WENT
INTO THE ROOM ON THREE DIFFERENT DAYS, GOT BITTEN BY 15 MOSQUITOES
EACH TIME. THE FIRST TWO DAYS, NOTHING HAPPENED.

“MAJOR REED WAS SUCH A HERO IN MY EYES THAT I WAS REALLY
DISAPPOINTED WITH MYSELF, AND SO WAS HE,” DECLARED MORAN IN AN
ASSOCIATED PRESS INTERVIEW. HE NOW IS LIVING IN HAVANA.

BUT MORAN WENT INTO THE ROOM A THIRD TIME--AND A FEW DAYS
LATER, ON CHRISTMAS DAY, DEVELOPED A FULL BLOWN CASE OF YELLOW FEVER!

MEANWHILE, VOLUNTEERS WHO HAD STAYED LONG PERIODS IN THE
MOSQUITO-PROTECTED PART OF THE SAME BUILDING, REMAINED FREE OF FEVER.

THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE TEST WAS CLEARLY APPARENT: THERE COULD
BE NO QUESTION NOW ABOUT THE ROLE PLAYED BY THE MOSQUITO.
MORAN SAYS REED TOLD HIM ON THAT MEMORABLE CHRISTMAS DAY:
“‘MR. MORAN, THIS IS ONE OF THE HAPPIEST DAYS OF MY LIFE.’”

DR. ROBERT P. COOKE, A “CONTRACT DOCTOR” WITH THE ARMY,
WAS ONE OF THE VOLUNTEERS FOR THE “INFECTED BEDDING” TEST.

NOW LIVING IN RETIREMENT ON A FARM AT WHISTLE CREEK, VA.,
NOT FAR FROM LEXINGTON, COOKE TOLD THE ASSOCIATED PRESS:

“WE FIGURED TO BE DEAD OR WELL WITHIN SIX OR EIGHT DAYS
AFTER WE STARTED THE TESTS. NO, I WASN'T PARTICULARLY SCARED....”

MORAN, COOKE AND JAMES L. HANBERRY OF ORANGEBURG, S.C.
ARE THE ONLY THREE KNOWN SURVIVORS AMONG THE ORIGINAL americanVOLUNTEERS.

HANBERRY PARTICIPATED IN THE “INFECTED BEDDING”
TEST, AND THEN LATER VOLUNTEERED TO BE BITTEN BY MOSQUITOES. HE CONTRACTED A
SEVERE CASE OF YELLOW FEVER.

OF THE 15 25 or more VOLUNTEERS, 14 GOT FEVER EITHER FROM MOSQUITO
BITES OF FROM INFECTED BLOOD OR SERUM INJECTED INTO THEIR
BODIES. NONE OF THEM DIED FROM THE INFECTIONS.

THE NAMES OF THE ALL THE AMERICAN VOLUNTEERS
TOGETHER WITH THOSE OF REED AND HIS ASSOCIATES AND THE SOLDIER WHO
CONTRACTED FEVER IN THE EARLIER TESTS CONSTITUTE A SPECIAL
“ROLL OF HONOR” PUBLISHED BY LAW IN THE OFFICIAL ARMY REGISTER.

IT IS AN HONOR UNSHARED BY AMERICA'S HEROES ON THE
FIELD OF BATTLE.

DR. PHILIP HENCH OF THE MAYO CLINIC WHO HAS MADE AN
AVOCATION OF THE WALTER REED EPIC, AND WHO HAS CONTRIBUTED MUCH TO
THE CLARIFICATION OF THE HISTORIC EVENTS, SAID NOT LONG AGO AT A
MEMORIAL MEETING IN HONOR OF REED AND THE OTHERS:

“IN THESE DAYS, WHEN MAN'S INHUMANITY TO MAN IS STILL
SO PATHETICALLY APPARENT, IT IS WELL FOR US TO NOTE THE EXAMPLE OF
THESE MEN WHO BANDED TOGETHER FOR HIGH ADVENTURE, NOT TO KILL OR
EVEN DIE FOR ONE COUNTRY BUT TO DIE IF NEED BE FOR THEIR FELLOW
MEN OF ALL COUNTRIES XXX.”
(END ADVANCE FOR AMS OF SUNDAY, JUNE 25)
